issue.title: Evaluate Conditional Expressions for projections with subqueries #3563
issue.body:
Add Conditional Expression evaluation to GetMemberAccessesVisitor and ReplaceMemberAccessesVisitor

Fixes #3563

body: My branch is way ahead of master, any change it's guaranteed to have merge conflicts. I think this should wait.
Meanwhile you can skip the null check with `DoNotAllowNull`, unless it's _your_ null check that's causing the issue.

@lbargaoanu Thanks for your response. I understand the merge issues. Setting AllowNullDestinationValues to false still generates and invalid expression though:

```
OrderId = (Guid?)((dtoLet.MostImportantOrderLine != null) ? dtoOrder : null).Id
```

Yes, my null check is causing an issue, but I do believe that this is an actual bug in the expression evaluation. This scenario is an abstraction of my actual code that will be running in production at some point in the future. The actual code makes more sense, especially considering a legacy database with exotic structures in it, but this code was an easy way to reproduce with recognizable class names.

Waiting for 11.0, while not ideal, is okay if there is no other choice. I see the entire ExpressionBuilder class has been (re)moved in your branch, so I'm not sure where these changes would land in the future. I could have a look around in your branch to see if the issue is already fixed or easily fixable, if that's okay with you?
You can PR my branch and then you'll be able to use the MyGet build. Let's start with a failing test in the integration tests project.

issue.title: Evaluate Conditional Expressions for projections with subqueries
issue.body: Add failing integration test as discussed in #3563

body:
@lbargaoanu I've created a new PR with a failing integration test and then the fix in a separate commit, so you can verify.

Thanks for your time!
This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
